newsitem.title: UK: BankAmerica plans 1.0 bln mark asset-backed bond.
newsitem.headline: BankAmerica plans 1.0 bln mark asset-backed bond.

text.p: BankAmerica is due to issue a 1.0 billion mark seven-year asset-backed bond next week, syndicate managers said on Friday.
Salomon Brothers will lead manage the issue, and an official there confirmed the deal was in the pipeline.

The bond will have a fixed-rate structure, similar to the 1.0 billion mark five-year deal Salomon brought for Capital Credit Card Corp in July, which was the sector's first fixed-rate asset-backed bond.
Spread talk was 35 basis points over the September 2003 Bund, but the Salomon official said it could be lower than that.
Asset-backed securities are usually issued through special purpose vehicles in which future credit card or mortgage payments are placed.
The first mark-denominated asset-backed bond was launched in April this year when Citibank launched a 1.0 billion mark three-year FRN.
The advantage of fixed-rate asset-backed paper is European instititutional investors find it easier to understand the structure, dealers said.
